result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nieshia O Rowell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nieshia O Rowell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nieshia O Rowell in court in person.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court in person for Nieshia O Rowell.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel informs the court that there is a conflict because of the co-defendant. Counsel has to withdraw. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Nieshia O Rowell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/23/22 @ 2:30p
